title: Our guide to every Week 14 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Shedeur Sanders vs. Cam Ward? Joe Burrow vs. Josh Allen? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 14 game.

title: Barnwell's end of the year prove-it list: 17 coaches and players with something at stake
content: Kenneth Walker III is among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

title: LeBron scores 8; record double-digit streak ends
content: LeBron James had a chance to extend his record double-digit scoring streak but opted to pass the ball, setting up Rui Hachimura's winning 3-pointer at the buzzer against the Raptors.

title: Sources: Penn St. turns focus to ISU's Campbell
content: Iowa State coach Matt Campbell has emerged as the focus of Penn State's head coaching search, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: FSU QB Castellanos seeking more eligibility
content: Florida State quarterback Thomas Castellanos is appealing to the NCAA for another year of eligibility.

title: E. Campbell died of drowning after medical issue
content: Former basketball player Elden Campbell died Monday from drowning after suffering a medical emergency while out fishing, his sister and a Broward County official confirmed.

title: Cowboys not 'deflated' by harder path to playoffs
content: Dak Prescott said the Cowboys would use their loss to the Lions, and the tougher odds to make the postseason, as "fuel" with four games to go.

title: Gottlieb tosses chair after Green Bay blows game
content: Green Bay coach Doug Gottlieb threw a chair as he walked off the court after his team blew an 11-point lead in an "embarrassing" 80-78 loss to Robert Morris.

title: Maxey's 'amazing' block preserves 76ers' win
content: Tyrese Maxey's block of De'Anthony Melton in the final seconds preserved the 76ers 99-98 win over the Warriors on Thursday night.

title: Pirates send Oviedo to Red Sox in 5-player deal
content: The Red Sox acquired right-hander Johan Oviedo from the Pirates in a five-player trade that sent outfield prospect Jhostynxon Garcia, also known as "The Password," to Pittsburgh.

title: ↔️ MLB winter meetings: Free agency intel
content: Here's our latest intel heading into the MLB winter meetings, starting with the slugger who holds the key to the offseason.

title: CFP chaos scenarios for every league and what to watch in nine conference titles
content: Bill Connelly looks at key angles for all nine games -- and why the playoff committee could get a headache.

title: LeBron and the legend of the eight points: 'I will be showing my son this box score'
content: Not many can recall the last time LeBron James scored fewer than 10 points. Why? Because it was in 2007.

title: 10 NFL veterans who could unexpectedly be on the move this offseason: Surprise cut, trade candidates
content: Would the Eagles trade A.J. Brown in the offseason? Could the Ravens face salary cap decisions on two stars? Is Kyler Murray's time in Arizona running out?

title: Myles Garrett's journey to the NFL sack record: 'It is written'
content: Four sacks shy of making NFL history, the Cleveland Browns veteran is among the all-time great pass rushers.

title: The old, struggling Clippers have options -- none of them good
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst surveyed the league on LA's next steps. Three difficult paths emerged.

title: This East lead hasn't come easy for the Pistons' young core
content: With every win, Detroit and its young core are moving further away from the dregs of a grueling rebuild.

title: Why team-provided housing has become a flashpoint
content: As both sides continue negotiations ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline, housing emerged as an issue in the latest proposal.

title: The 30 best MMA fighters under 30 in 2025
content: From top stars Ilia Topuria and Dakota Ditcheva to rising contenders Joshua Van and Natalia Silva, ESPN ranks the top 30 fighters under age 30.

title: Power Rankings: Michigan leaps to No. 1, plus 5 new faces
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's most intriguing December game
content: The Capitals, Penguins and Flyers are the big risers this week, with the Ducks, Devils and Mammoth sliding.

title: Awards Watch: MacKinnon jumps to massive lead in MVP race
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races -- and some clear favorites have emerged.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 14: Trevor Lawrence and other QB replacements
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Jaguars' passing game and Titans defense.

title: MLS Cup in Miami is all about Messi. Can Müller, Vancouver crash the party?
content: It's fitting that MLS Cup takes place on the same weekend as Miami's art fair, as old masters Lionel Messi and Thomas Müller prepare to face off.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Can Real Betis halt Barcelona run?
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar as Julien Laurens picks out the best games ahead in Europe.

title: Signing day 2026: Virginia Tech raids Penn State; Houston, Vandy go big and more
content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man United eye Mouzakitis
content: Real Madrid could rival Manchester United to sign Olympiacos wonderkid Christos Mouzakitis. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: India, Russia agree on Arctic and nuclear cooperation
content: With polar ice melting, new sea routes may open in the Arctic; India, Russia welcome progress made in cooperation on the Northern Sea Route; India will “strive to” allot a site for a second nuclear plant after Kudankulam

title: Pawan Kalyan urges teachers to nurture achievers, not ‘manufacture employees’
content: Deputy Chief Minister stresses coordination among students, parents, and teachers; promises books, playground plan and warns against politicisation and substance abuse

title: YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy cries foul over CID, ACB probe into Parakamani theft case
content: The investigation has not been done as directed by the court, the former TTD chairman alleges, and vows to quit politics if his alleged links with the main accused is proven

title: Telangana Rising 2047 Vision document getting final touches
content: Encompassing sector-specific plans to pave the way towards $3 trillion economy goal of Telangana; the document, in English, Telugu and Urdu, will be presented to 1,000 delegates

title: A.P. liquor scam: remand of nine accused extended till Dec. 19
content: Producing a key accused, Anil Chokhara, in the court, SIT sleuths claimed that he was instrumental in diverting the liquor scam proceeds through 35 shell companies

title: How Vizag woman’s death brought to light biggest organ-trafficking network in Andhra Pradesh
content: The 29-year-old woman left home saying she was going on a trip with friends, but it turned out to be her tragic end. The death of the woman from a below poverty line family exposed how vulnerable individuals and families fall prey to illegal organ sale networks. K. Umashanker and Harish Gilai delve deep into the racket allegedly operating from Global Multi-Specialty Hospital in Madanapalle

title: TDP leader condemns Jagan’s comments on ghee adulteration and Parakamani theft cases
content: How can the cases appear to be inconsequential for the YSRCP president, questions TDP official spokesman Vijay Kumar

title: Congress slams Modi government as IndiGo cancellations spark nationwide disruption
content: Rahul Gandhi links IndiGo crisis to the Centre’s monopoly model while the Congress accuses the government of weakening competition in India’s aviation sector

title: Kerala Governor, Chief Minister lock horns over selection of Vice-Chancellors
content: Pinarayi accuses Arlekar of violating SC directive regarding the appointment of Vice-Chancellors to KTU and digital university by picking a candidate the CM had found ineligible. Lok Bhavan says SC had clearly said that the Chancellor was free to have his reservations about the candidates recommended by the CM

title: Campaign against ‘privatisation’ of medical colleges receives overwhelming response, says YSRCP leader Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy
content: Over one crore signatures have been collected in one week and the numbers are growing rapidly, he claims, adding the people’s movement has transformed into a massive pubic uprising

title: Surendran alleges attempts to protect Rahul Mamkoottathil
content: The former BJP State president claims that the Kerala government is playing a “hide-and-seek” game by delaying the arrest of the suspect

title: 97 new recruits join Fire and Rescue Services
content: DG Nitin Agrawal says the exemplary rescue operations carried out by the force have earned immense public trust and admiration

title: Government revamping communications machinery, pushes for unified outreach
content: The aim is to ensure real-time media response mechanisms and data-driven campaign planning for a more streamlined public communications framework; need for unified approach to communications was felt acutely during Operation Sindoor, says official

title: Commissioning of EVMs begins in Kozhikode
content: The commissioning began in the blocks of Perambra, Vadakara, Kozhikode, Melady, Chelanur, and Koduvally, as well as in the municipalities of Koyilandy and Ramanattukara

title: Supreme Court denies mercy plea of ‘Swami’ serving life for killing Shakereh Khaleeli
content: Swami Shraddhanand was convicted in 2000 for murdering his wife, Shakereh Khaleeli, in 1991 with the motive of taking control of her property

title: A.P. Agriculture Department’s initiative to boost farmers’ income through value addition
content: Transforming the thought process of the farmers requires RSK functionaries to take a proactive role in guiding cultivation practices towards demand-based crops, global market linkages, and value-added production, says Director of Agriculture Manazir Jeelani Samoon

title: Pinarayi ridicules ED notice to KIIFB
content: Chief Minister says government and the board will legally fight the ED move highlighting the fact that funds have been raised for infrastructure development through the masala bonds in accordance with the guidelines laid down by the Reserve Bank of India

title: Putin Backs Early Signing Of India, Eurasian Economic Union Trade Agreement
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said early signing of the preferential trade agreement between India and the Eurasian Economic Union will reduce barriers to facilitate the movement of goods, services and capital.

title: Vladimir Putin In India LIVE Updates: Putin Arrives At Rashtrapati Bhavan, President Murmu Receives Him
content: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: Lok Sabha Passes Bill To Levy Cess On Pan Masala Manufacturing Units
content: The Lok Sabha on Friday passed a bill to levy a cess on manufacturing units of pan masala, and utilise the fund for strengthening national security and improving public health.

title: Cold Wave, Toxic Air: Why Delhi's Pollution Peaks in November-December
content: Every winter, Delhi's air turns toxic, and this year is no exception. After the monsoon, pollution levels rise, but the real crisis begins when temperatures plunge.

title: IndiGo Flights Disruption Live Updates: "Expect Complete Restoration In 3 Days," Says Minister On Crisis
content: IndiGo on Friday cancelled till midnight all its domestic flights departing from the Delhi airport as the airline continues to grapple with significant operational disruptions.

title: IndiGo CEO Says Less Than 1,000 Cancellations Tomorrow, Normalcy By Dec 15
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers issued a public apology this evening after more than a thousand flights were cancelled today, the most severely impacted day in terms of cancellations.

title: In Madhya Pradesh, MPs Are Skipping Assembly: The Reason Is Wedding Season
content: Over a dozen MLAs from the treasury and Opposition benches skipped the Question Hour of the Madhya Pradesh assembly on Friday despite their queries being listed for replies.

title: "Not Robots": Raghav Chadha Underlines 3 'Pain-Points' Of Delivery Agents
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Raghav Chadha on Friday urged Parliament to end 10-minute delivery services run by quick-commerce platforms.

title: Tunnel To Ease Key Bengaluru Bottleneck Gets Nod, Draws Flak From BJP
content: Eight years after the controversial steel flyover project was scrapped following opposition and environmental concerns, the Karnataka cabinet has cleared a proposal to address the traffic congestion between Hebbal Junction and Mekhri Circle

title: EMI Nation: 28 Crore People In India Have Outstanding Loans, Debt Hits Rs 15.7 Lakh Crore
content: India is witnessing a sharp rise in household borrowing, signalling a growing dependence on loans to meet aspirations and expenses.

title: Tensions High In Madhya Pradesh After Obscene Video Of Minor Goes Viral
content: Tensions were high in Madhya Pradesh's Shamgarh city on Friday after a horrifying case of blackmail and the circulation of an obscene video of a 16-year-old girl came to light.

title: 'No Group Or Individual Can Issue Decrees': Manipur Government's Warning
content: The government in Manipur - a state that will complete one year of the President's rule in two months - has clarified that no individual or group can issue decrees, impose punishments or restrict lawful cultural, economic and artistic activities.

title: Misuse To Land Grab, Madhya Pradesh 'IT Parks' Have Everything But IT Firms
content: A new report by the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) has revealed that plots reserved exclusively for Information Technology (IT) companies are being widely misused across major IT parks in Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, and Gwalior.

title: Centre Orders High-Level Probe Into IndiGo Crisis, Expects Fix In 3 Days
content: In what will be music to the ears of passengers hit hard by the IndiGo disruptions, the Centre has said flight schedules are expected to stabilise by Saturday and a return to normalcy is likely to be achieved within three days, which would be Monday.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport To Get Railway Station, "Special Gift," Says Fadnavis
content: Ahead of operations beginning at the Navi Mumbai International Airport on December 25, the airport will also get a railway station nearby, as the Targhar station on the Uran-Belapur line is also operationalised.

title: India Will Soon Launch Free 30-Day Visas For Russian Citizens: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that people-to-people connections have always held a special place in bilateral relations and New Delhi will soon launch a free 30-day e-tourist visa and a 30-day group tourist visa for Russian citizens.

title: Cannot Deport Bangla-Speaking People To Bangladesh: Trinamool MP
content: TMC's Shatabdi Roy said Bangla-speaking people are being deported to Bangladesh and asserted that language cannot be a consideration for authorities for taking such steps.

title: 'Not Promoting Cigarettes': Top Court's No To Ban On Arundhati Roy's Memoir
content: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking ban of acclaimed author Arundhati Roy's book, 'Mother Mary Comes to Me', alleging that the cover picture depicts the author smoking cigarette/beedi in violation of a central legislation.

title: Netflix To Acquire Warner Bros. Discovery For Nearly $83 Billion
content: Netflix has agreed to acquire film and television studio Warner Bros. Discovery for nearly $83 billion, the two US companies announced Friday.

title: Tirupati Temple Reserves 90% Vaikuntha Darshan Time For Common Devotees
content: In good news for Tirupati temple pilgrims, a substantial 90 per cent of the available Vaikuntha Dwara Darshan time, 164 hours out of a total 182 hours, has been earmarked for common devotees through the electronic lucky dip (e-dip) system.

title: Shrew thought to have been extinct for over two centuries photographed in the Nilgiris
content: The species was described in 1813 near Puducherry by French naturalist Pierre Sonnerat. So far, no specimen has ever been collected. On October 1, 2022, wildlife biologists and researchers working in the Nilgiris photographed a dead shrew near Ooty Lake in Udhagamandalam

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: municipalities to witness tight contests in Kozhikode
content: While the Left Democratic Front swept the Kozhikode Corporation and retained control over major rural local bodies, the United Democratic Front gained a narrow edge in the municipalities, winning four of the seven

title: Congress slams Arunachal Minister’s ‘no scheme if BJP loses’ threat
content: The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party has won a sizeable number of panchayat and municipal seats in the State unopposed

title: YSRCP slams demolition of 42 houses in Joji Nagar in Vijayawada
content: Party leaders say the action defies Supreme Court orders and is carried out without notice, adding that they will pursue legal and political measures to support the displaced families

title: Senior leaders of TNCC miffed that Praveen Chakravarty met TVK chief Vijay
content: They say such ‘unauthorised meetings’ may destabilise and derail negotiations with the DMK, the party’s senior ally for the 2026 Assembly election

title: Madvi Hidma encounter: Police stop ‘fact-finding’ team from Osmania University at Chintoor
content: The 12-member team mostly consisting of law students of Osmania University were heading towards Maredumilli forest to see the encounter site, interact with the locals and police officials who were involved in the operation

title: App-based registration begins for Bhavani Deeksha viramana at Kanaka Durga temple
content: Mandatory registration on the Bhavani Deekshalu App helps streamline services during the December 11 to 15 ceremonies, says the temple EO

title: Telangana, Australia’s Deakin University ink pact to set up CoE for AI
content: The CoE will be first-of-its-kind skill development facility dedicated to advanced AI capabilities to be set up at the upcoming AI University in Bharat Future City

title: Telangana Govt. invites Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrabau Naidu for Global Summit-2025 in Hyderabad
content: Scheduled to be organised on December 8 and 9, the summit serves as a platform for discussions on economic growth, industrial development, and trade opportunities, says Telangana R&B Minister Komatireddy Venkata Reddy after meeting the Chief Minister

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: open campaigning for Phase 1 to end on December 7
content: Seven districts—Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Idukki, Alappuzha, and Ernakulam—go to the polls on December 9 in the first phase

title: Centre ‘reworking and refining’ procedures to resume MGNREGA scheme in West Bengal
content: Centre froze MGNREGA funds to the State in March 2022, citing continued non-compliance with Central directives; in June 2025, the Calcutta HC ordered resumption of the scheme, which the SC upheld in October

title: Delhi High Court upholds MHA policy barring colour-blind recruits in CAPFs
content: The court says the 2013 guidelines on defective vision in central forces are neither arbitrary nor unreasonable, noting that recruits diagnosed during training were still on probation

title: Global teaching methods will be adopted in govt. schools, says A.P. CM
content: Students’ performance will be monitored constantly, instead of assessing standards only after the correction of exam papers, says Naidu; plans are afoot to organise a student innovators partnership summit

title: Continuation of 10 paise ceiling limit no longer necessary on power surcharge, observes Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission
content: Commission to hold online public hearing on proposal to remove 10 paise cap on surcharge on December 23

title: Kerala government bars non-teaching staff in aided colleges from uploading internal marks colleges
content: Following a detailed review, the government concluded that internal marks of students in aided colleges must be uploaded only by the heads of departments or designated teaching staff.

title: World Book of Records recognises Nitish Kumar’s 10th term as Bihar CM
content: In a letter congratulating Mr. Kumar, the World Book of Records, London, stated that it is a matter of pride for the country that, from 1947 to 2025; Nitish Kumar is the first person in the country to be sworn in as Chief Minister ten times

title: DMK is resorting to minority appeasement, says BJP leader Annamalai
content: He criticises the government for defying the orders of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court that allowed 10 persons to climb the Thirupparankundram hill and light the lamp on dheepathoon

title: Kozhikode has 26.82 lakh voters on final electoral roll
content: The updated list, according to officials, aims to ensure maximum participation and accuracy ahead of the polling process

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: India, Russia agree to continue working towards enhancing trade in national currencies
content: The countries reiterated their commitment to meeting the bilateral trade target of $100 billion by 2030, with PM Modi saying it could be achieved earlier.

title: Tezpur varsity imbroglio: Senior-most faculty member assumes suo motu charge as acting V-C
content: An agitating student said the protest and the 'shutdown' will continue unless an enquiry into the alleged corruption and other forms of irregularities by the V-C is ordered.

title: SEIL Energy to set up ₹4.5-crore ‘Inclusive Sports Academy’ in Nellore
content: The all-weather stadium will come up at Composite Regional Centre for Skill Development, Rehabilitation and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities

title: Rs 70k to B'luru but Rs 25k to London: Fares reach sky amid IndiGo crisis; flyers rush for options
content: IndiGo's massive operational chaos led to hundreds of flight cancellations and exorbitant domestic fares, with Delhi-Bengaluru tickets reaching Rs 70,000. International destinations like Thailand and London offered significantly cheaper alternatives. The airline's miscalculation of pilot needs under new regulations caused widespread traveler distress and criticism over its management.

title: 'Everyone has their own conscience': Cong vs Tharoor flares up again over Putin dinner invite
content: Congress leaders criticized MP Shashi Tharoor for accepting an invitation to a Presidential dinner for Vladimir Putin, while Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge were excluded. Leaders questioned the government's intentions and Tharoor's decision, highlighting a perceived snub to the opposition and a departure from democratic traditions.

title: IndiGo fiasco: Railways comes to the rescue; adds 116 coaches amid passenger rush
content: Indian Railways has deployed 116 extra coaches across 37 trains to ease passenger travel disruptions caused by the IndiGo flight crisis. Northern Railways is also running five special trains to manage the increased demand. This initiative aims to accommodate the unexpected surge in travelers seeking alternative routes, with various coach types added based on route needs.

title: Alarm bells before ODI decider? India coach warns South Africa: 'We’re desperate'
content: India faces a 'desperate' situation in the series decider against South Africa, admits assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate. Following a Test series loss and a 1-1 ODI scoreline, the team understands the pressure. Dew is a major factor, forcing adaptation in batting and bowling strategies. India aims to maximize scores despite challenging conditions.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly slashing its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its ambitious virtual reality vision after incurring over $70 billion in losses. This move comes as the company doubles down on artificial intelligence, investing heavily in AI infrastructure and talent acquisition.

title: 'Told to move car': UP woman dies after drunk duo plough into family; 2 others critical
content: A dispute over parking and drinking escalated violently in Bijnor when two men allegedly rammed their car into a family. The incident, which occurred after the family asked the men to leave, resulted in the death of one woman and serious injuries to two others. The accused have been arrested.

title: Heavy fine! Pakistan's Zaman faces ICC punishment: What did he do wrong?
content: Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman has been fined 10 per cent of his match fee and received one demerit point for a Level 1 ICC Code of Conduct breach. The violation occurred during the Tri-Series final against Sri Lanka when Zaman showed dissent towards an umpire's dismissal decision. He admitted the offence and accepted the proposed sanction.

title: Pak military revamp: Asim Munir appointed first CDF; 5-year tenure begins
content: Pakistan has officially appointed Field Marshal Asim Munir as the country's first Chief of Defence Forces (CDF), a significant military restructuring. This new role consolidates operational and strategic authority under a single command, aiming for faster decision-making. Munir will concurrently serve as Chief of Army Staff for a five-year term.

title: Gemini 3 Deep Think: Pichai praises model; says it has ‘strongest’ reasoning abilities
content: Google's Gemini 3 Deep Think mode is now available for AI Ultra subscribers, offering its most advanced reasoning yet. This new feature tackles complex math, science, and logic problems by exploring multiple hypotheses simultaneously.  Google claims industry-leading performance on rigorous benchmarks, promising more refined and detailed outputs for users to visualize and experiment with.

title: ‘No means no’: Tharoor introduces bill to criminalise marital rape, says ‘only yes means yes’
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has introduced a bill in the Lok Sabha to criminalise marital rape. The proposed law aims to remove the current exception that allows non-consensual sex within marriage. Tharoor stressed the urgent need to uphold women's rights and constitutional values. The bill seeks to amend the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: IndiGo crisis: Bengaluru couple attends own wedding reception virtually
content: A newlywed couple, stranded in Bhubaneswar due to IndiGo flight cancellations, virtually attended their own wedding reception in Hubballi.  Their parents represented them at the venue, with the couple appearing on a large screen via video call.  This incident highlights the widespread travel chaos caused by airline operational issues, prompting calls for government intervention.

title: Investing FOMO: How do you stop it from running your money life? Explained
content: When markets boom, wedding conversations shift to stock tips, fueling FOMO. Investors often chase recent gains, entering late and exiting during downturns, leading to lower actual returns. A disciplined approach, focusing on long-term goals and a small 'mad money' allocation for experiments, is key to navigating market hype.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife’s donations: Scott cuts Amazon stake; gives millions to DEI causes
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros: Why it is a BIG deal
content: Two and a half decades later, that humble mail-order start-up is preparing to buy the studio that helped build modern Hollywood itself. Netflix’s planned acquisition of Warner Bros – the century-old home of Casablanca, Harry Potter, DC superheroes, The Lord of the Rings (via New Line), HBO and control of classics like The Wizard of Oz – for an enterprise value of roughly 82.7 billion dollars marks a transformative moment in entertainment history. For the first time, a company that began its life shipping DVDs is about to take ownership of a film and television library that has shaped global culture for a hundred years.

title: Gautam Gambhir under fire! 'Stop confusing him': Ex-India star blasts team management
content: Ravichandran Ashwin urged head coach Gautam Gambhir to provide Washington Sundar with clear role clarity as a primary bowler who can bat. Ashwin highlighted India's finishing struggles and questioned if a fast-bowling all-rounder like Nitish Kumar Reddy might be a better option given the team's bowling limitations.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Los Angeles Lakers vs Toronto Raptors regular season game - Full injury report
content: The Lakers and Raptors face significant injury woes as they clash on December 4, 2025. With Luka Doncic and Marcus Smart out for LA, and Jakob Poeltl and RJ Barrett sidelined for Toronto, depth players will be crucial. This game becomes a test of adaptability and which supporting cast can step up.

title: IND vs SA: Records Virat Kohli can shatter; India gear up for 3rd ODI in Vizag
content: India and South Africa are tied 1-1 heading into their final ODI, a series marked by high-scoring games and broken batting records. Virat Kohli is on the verge of multiple century milestones, while both teams could set new records for successful 350+ chases. The decisive match promises further batting fireworks.

title: Ryan Kesler faces new trial decision over criminal sexual charges
content: Former Vancouver Canucks and Anaheim Ducks forward Ryan Kesler is officially headed toward trial after a new court decision on Thursday confirmed the case will move forward. Kesler faces two misdemeanor counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct tied to a January incident in Orchard Lake, Michigan. The latest ruling reinforces the prosecution’s position, while Kesler continues to maintain his not-guilty plea.

title: IPL: New RR captain? Riyan Parag breaks silence after Samson’s shocking CSK trade
content: With Sanju Samson's departure to CSK, Rajasthan Royals are considering Riyan Parag as their next captain. Parag, who captained RR in Samson's absence last season, expressed his readiness for the role but emphasized the management's decision will be made post-auction. He also acknowledged the significant workload leadership entails.

title: Nasa warns about back to back asteroids in the near future, what to expect
content: Two asteroids are set for safe flybys near Earth, reassuring the public that no threat exists. NASA emphasizes these events highlight the dynamic solar system and the crucial work of tracking celestial objects. While these particular visitors pose no danger, their observation aids in refining orbital predictions and bolstering planetary defence strategies for the future.

title: 'Will undress on your counter’: Flyer threatens to remove clothes amid IndiGo cancellations - watch
content: A passenger threatened to undress at Delhi airport amid IndiGo's widespread operational disruptions. The airline cancelled all domestic departures from Delhi until midnight on December 5th, 2025, stranding thousands. This incident underscores growing traveler frustration with IndiGo's ongoing crew shortages and operational challenges.

title: Govt puts new crew duty rule in abeyance; expects IndiGo normalcy by Monday
content: The government has suspended new flight duty time limitation rules for pilots, aiming to normalize IndiGo's flight schedules by Monday. This decision, made in the interest of passengers, follows IndiGo's cancellation of over 750 flights. A high-level inquiry will investigate the disruptions and determine accountability.

title: Savings in several lakhs! How much money has RBI put in your pocket in 2025? Check calculations
content: RBI repo rate cut EMI calculations: While the 25 basis points rate cut will give marginal relief to new and existing loan borrowers, it is the cumulative 1.25% rate cut since the start of this year, that will yield substantial savings over the entire loan tenure.

title: Aspiration pneumonia: Doctor explains how a simple accident can turn life-threatening
content: A simple sip of water can turn life-threatening, leading to aspiration pneumonia when liquid enters the lungs instead of the stomach. This condition, often caused by bacteria in aspirated material, inflames lung tissue and impairs breathing.  Elderly individuals and those with swallowing difficulties are particularly at risk. Early recognition and prevention are key.

title: CeeDee Lamb ruled out vs. Lions after concussion in major Cowboys setbac
content: Dallas Cowboys wide receiver CeeDee Lamb was ruled out of Thursday's game against the Detroit Lions after suffering a concussion on a hard fall while attempting a diving catch.  He exhibited a fencing response, a common sign of head trauma, and will now enter concussion protocol, making his status for the next game uncertain.

title: INDvsSA: 'He can’t fit in India’s plans'- Ashwin reveals why selectors are ignoring Parag
content: Ravichandran Ashwin believes Riyan Parag isn't ready for India's ODI middle order despite growing calls for his inclusion. Ashwin noted Parag's lack of experience batting at No. 5 or 6, stating the youngster needs to demonstrate adaptability at the domestic level to push for those crucial slots.

title: 'Agreed on economic cooperation plan till 2030': PM Modi in joint statement with Putin - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Modi hailed India-Russia ties as a "North star" in a changing world, announcing an economic cooperation program until 2030. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to energy security and combating terrorism. Discussions also covered trade, with Russia pledging continued fuel shipments to India's growing economy.

title: Home loan interest rates set to fall to historic low of 7.1% after RBI move
content: Home loan rates are poised to fall to Covid-era lows following a 25 basis point repo rate cut by the RBI. This move is expected to lower EMIs for borrowers, though banks may need to adjust deposit rates. Non-banking finance companies anticipate immediate benefits from reduced funding costs, aiding last-mile financiers and small businesses.

title: Magic Johnson pushes for All-Star nod as Lakers’ unsung hero shines vs Raptors
content: Austin Reaves delivered a season-shifting performance, scoring 44 points and dishing out 11 assists to lead a short-handed Lakers to a 123-120 victory over the Raptors.  Magic Johnson publicly backed Reaves for an All-Star spot, highlighting his dominant play and leadership in a crucial win that strengthens the Lakers' Western Conference push.

title: IND vs SA: 'Where was the intent?' - Ex-cricketer slams Jadeja, blames knock for Raipur defeat
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan criticised Ravindra Jadeja's slow batting in the second ODI loss to South Africa. Pathan believes Jadeja's lack of urgency, scoring 24 off 27 balls, cost India crucial runs. Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, the team failed to capitalise fully, allowing South Africa to chase a formidable target.

title: Frustrated, lying on floors, confused: Videos capture chaos as IndiGo cancels 500+ flights; watch
content: India's aviation sector faced a severe meltdown as IndiGo cancelled over 400 flights, leaving thousands stranded and airports in chaos. Passengers endured long waits and exorbitant fares on other airlines due to the crisis, triggered by cabin crew shortages. IndiGo expects full operational recovery only by February 2026, highlighting a significant disruption.

title: Harvard-trained doctor shares 5 glycolic acid secrets you probably didn’t know
content: Glycolic acid, a dermatologist-trusted ingredient, offers versatile skincare benefits beyond facial treatments. It effectively combats back acne by dissolving pore buildup, softens rough elbows and knees, and smooths persistent bumps from keratosis pilaris. Additionally, it prevents ingrown hairs and tackles foot odor and calluses by shedding dead skin.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS reveals glowing coma plasma and dust tails in Juice NavCam images
content: ESA's Juice spacecraft has captured striking new images of Comet 3I/ATLAS, revealing its active coma and distinct plasma and dust tails. While originally designed for Jupiter, Juice's navigation camera provided an early glimpse of the comet's activity. Full scientific data, gathered by five specialized instruments, is expected in February 2026, promising deeper insights into this interstellar visitor.

title: IND vs SA: ‘Never shirked responsibility’; RCB head coach defends under-fire Gambhir
content: Andy Flower, in Dubai for ILT20 commentary and RCB scouting, praised Virat Kohli’s hunger and “incredible standard” after his back-to-back ODI tons. The RCB coach backed India head coach Gautam Gambhir amid criticism following consecutive home Test series defeats, saying responsibility cannot fall on one man. Flower also urged India to avoid extreme turners, insisting their talent is strong enough to win on sporting pitches.

title: 'Murdered all kids on Ekadashi': Occult omen or mental illness? Disturbing pattern of Haryana's 'killer mom'
content: A mother in Hisar/Panipat is accused of drowning four children, including her own son. While her family and victims' kin suspect occult practices, police point to psychopathic tendencies and a lack of remorse. The accused reportedly confessed to killing children perceived as more beautiful than her own. Authorities are investigating further, dismissing supernatural claims.

title: Starc breaks Pak legend's big record: 'Super Starc!' — Wasim Akram posts classy message
content: Mitchell Starc has become the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test history, surpassing Wasim Akram's 414 wickets with a stellar 6/75 performance. Akram lauded Starc as a worthy successor, but the Australian humbly stated Akram remains the benchmark. Starc now ranks among Australia's top wicket-takers, with his pursuit of further milestones ongoing.

title: Gabrielle Union on infertility as Dwyane Wade had child during split
content: Gabrielle Union revealed the profound devastation she experienced when Dwyane Wade fathered a child with another woman during a 2013 split, especially as she struggled with infertility.  She felt her soul was shattered, believing she had to let Wade go if she didn't pursue surrogacy to give him the family he desired.

title: 5 tiger reserves that offer the strongest chances of seeing a tiger up close
content: India's tiger population is thriving, with five reserves consistently offering the best chances for sightings. Jim Corbett, Kaziranga, Bandhavgarh, Ranthambore, and Periyar stand out due to high densities, abundant prey, and effective conservation. These areas are crucial for ecological studies and provide unparalleled opportunities to witness these magnificent big cats in their natural habitat.

title: Satya Nadella says IQ still matters: Here's what professionals must learn
content: As AI reshapes the workplace, Satya Nadella warns that technical skill alone can’t guarantee success. He argues that emotional intelligence—empathy, collaboration, and human connection—is becoming the decisive career asset. With automation handling analytical tasks, Nadella urges professionals to build adaptability, communication, and interpersonal strength to stay relevant in an increasingly machine-driven economy.

title: 2026 World Cup draw: How it works, what will be decided
content: the stage is almost set for the 2026 world cup, which begins June 11 and concludes with the final July 19 . the draw ceremony will be held at noon ET (5 p.m. GMT) at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., on Dec. 5 .

title: IndiGo crisis: 'Plane ready but no pilot' - first-person account of a harried flyer

title: Live updates: World Cup groups, matches, reaction
content: It's time! The eyes and fate of several nations will be focused on the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., for the 2026  FIFA World Cup  group stage draw. Follow along for live updates, key statistics and instant reaction as we discover how the 48 teams will be placed across the United States, Mexico and Canada. Twelve groups of four will shape the road toward lifting soccer's biggest prize next summer in North America.

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: The best games, from Duke, Arkansas, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC Men's Challenge featured a bevy of AP top 25 men's college basketball teams . on Tuesday, the ACC came out swinging, with no. 4 Duke escaping an attempted double-digit comeback by no. 15 Florida by a single point . a one-possession victory for no. 16 North Carolina over no. 18 Kentucky ended the night up 6-2 on the SEC .

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: 'Coastal Chaos' and 7-5 Duke: Can the ACC's problems ever get resolved?
content: the ACC's system isn't much different than other conferences, coach says . it's a quirk of modern college football -- sprawling conferences with limited crossover between teams . if the stakes weren't so high, it might be a charming queirk of the conference .

title: Big day for Detroit offense powers Lions over Cowboys
content: quarterback Jahmyr Gibbs scores his third touchdown to widen the Lions' lead . he says the regular-season homestretch is a "must-win" game . it's the fifth time the team has scored at least 35 points this season .
